column1: Chronic Fungal Infection of Skin
column2: Polish Prince, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took this medication for a condition known as Tinea Versicolor. It causes splotches on the skin, caused by an abnormally high presence of yeast fungus. It's not contagious or bothersome, it just causes a splotchy/discored appearance.  It reoccurs every few years, most common among younger, active people. The best times to take it, I've discovered, are after a period of activity in which I've broken a sweat and have had something to eat. The discoloration after the medication is not from the medication, but from the abscence of the fungus in the treated area. These go away naturally in 4-6 weeks (or my first two weeks at the pool in which my tan begins to work). I've taken this medication along with a topical shampoo on three occasions and the Tinae Versicolor usually stays away for two years or so.  DO NOT DRINK ON THIS MEDICATION it can cause liver damage, try to at least have eaten or drink a full glass of milk with it.Hope this helps!

column1: Chronic Fungal Infection of Skin
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had a funky looking fungal infection that covered most of my back. It had been spreading for months (I was waiting for insurance to come through b4 I could go to the doctor). Once I got to the doctor and took the ketoconazole it began to clear up within a couple of days and now, 2 weeks later, it seems to have disappeared completely. So I'd say it's pretty effective.Side Effects: The first two days I was seriously dizzy but that went away and I didn't notice any other side effects for the remainder of the 2 weeks. One note: my skin has been extra itchy in the last couple of weeks(especially my face) but I have ridiculously sensitive skin that is always itchy so I don't think it's related to the medication but it might be so I figured I should mention it.

column1: Chronic Fungal Infection of Skin
column2: gpn, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My skin will break out once per year during the summer months.  The infection only appears on my upper body, chest and back. The spots are dark brown in color.  When I take the medication, I take it with food to avoid any stomach issues, no problem there.  The pills are small and easy to take.  I take it with right after eating breakfast in the morning.  Because I know for sure these pills wreaks havoc my the liver, I DRINK TONS OF water during the day. Next, and this one is tough, I DO NOT DRINK ANY ALCOHOL WHILE USING THIS DRUG FOR A MONTH, again to protect my liver as best I can.  Also, I don't sleep very well so normally I would take Tylenol PM, while using this drug, I DO NOT us T-PM.As far as side effects, I have two.  First, I get tired earlier now, like around 8 or 9 PM I'm ready for bed, rather than by 11 or Midnight. Second, I get really hot so I turn my AC down to about 75.

Will update after 3-4 month period with results

column1: Candidiasis Yeast Infection that Spreads Throughout Body
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started this medication for a yeast infection. i was prescribed one a day for a week then two a day. Within 32 pills I broke out in a rash all over my body, itching horribly, fever, difficulty breathing.Stomach pains,and increased anxiety. Also trouble sleeping.Completly miserable. I stopped the medication. It took a week for the rash to be about 90% cleared up. My skin still feels very sensitive. I never will take this medication again. I would read the warnings, reactions, and precations. My doctor said to stop taking it for a few days then start again to see if i havesame results. I am not going to try this again and put my body into so much pain.

column1: Yeast Infection of Vagina and Vulva
column2: KC, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took 18 days of a 21-day course of ketoconazole.  It gave me severe liver damage (toxic hepatitis) followed by severe arthralgia in every joint in my body except spine/neck/head.If I'd taken it a few more days it probably would have killed me.  Instead, it just resulted in about 6 months of being bedridden, followed by 3 years of major debilitating pain.I was an otherwise healthy 37 year old woman taking no other meds, and I had no symptoms at all before beginning the hepatitis symptoms.I eventually (as I said, 3 plus years later) worked the stuff through my body, and I'm basically healthy now, 10 years later.  Although I cannot say for sure, I believe that the arthritis I now have in my hands is a secondary (and permanent) effect--livable, but much worse than it should be, and I'm the only one out of all my parents and grandparents who has it.Believe the big boxed warning.

column1: Thrush

I had noticed shortness of breath and heart racing in the am and pm.  I stopped the Nizoral and the symptoms stopped immediately.  It may be a good medicine but not for me.

column2: techman, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Two days into treatment for a odd..hard to diagnose skin rash-infection that occcours initially with mild skin break - no depth or even blood (most recent episodes spanning over two years). Original episode about 6 years ago. Seeeminingly sucessfully treated then with Clotrimazole-Betamethasone & Bactrim (Mupirocin)cream and oral Cephalexin. Drs since then (more than 8 seen including derm. & aller.) kept saying it was Staph or Strep, but it would come back with vengence in a few weeks or month after treatment...especially if skin was broken (even through jeans). Got to a point I felt I might need a bubble :) . Have tried, at some point, Prednisone, Nystatin and Triamcin Acetonide, Altibax (retapamulin)ointment,Zeasorb AF (Miconazole Nitrate 2%),Amoxicillin and FLUCONAZOLE 1 tablet 150mg (WHICH ACTUALLY HELPED), and daily bating affected areas with Phisohex plus probably a few more that I don't recall or have current records on.
